Well done all!

All wonderful things come to an end! Thank you to all those who made #OEGlobal22 possible but also enjoyable. The programme was superb, the techi team was THE BEST, our co-presenter @IrwinDev drank lots of *strong* tea to be coherent at 2 am in Canada. Our super chair and 1/2
@ginofransman And you Gino, at the top of the list 🤍🌻🌍 #GO_GN #OEGlobal22

What better way to spend day 3 of #OEGlobal22 than back-to-back thought provoking workshops from @bonstewart on participatory open digital classrooms and @thatpsychprof on social justice in #oep https://t.co/Q0OhrLLL8D…

Who’s allowed to issue #credentials/#certification? Part of #OpenRecognition pairs well with #OpenEducation as it’s also open to alternatives, understood as such. Maybe #microcredentials as a way to enable collaboration instead of typical #HR processes… #OEGlobal22

How did 3 days go so quickly?

As we #decolonize #HigherEd, let’s not assume that #OERs meant for a dominant population will work for others. @lachainecath reminds #OEGlobal22 participants the burden put on minorities. #InvisibleKnapsack and #privilege

According to some #OEGlobal22 participant (likely European), #OERs would overcome geographical barriers. “Why don’t you use what’s done in Quebec?” 
As @lachainecath points out, Francophones are dispersed and rarely considered in educational policy, which is set by the province.

As we’re reminded @lachainecath reminds us, “#OpenEd is about breaking, language is an issue”. We need to critically address what #LanguageBarriers mean for underprivileged groups (including #IndigenousLanguages). #OEGlobal22

From #LitReview @lachainecath, scarce resources on #LanguageMinorities and #OpenEducation despite the fact, obvious to #OEGlobal22 participants, that the field is far from homogeneous. From 2020 report @carlabrc, obvious gap in our bilingual context.

As a fieldworker, @lachainecath knows to start with a telling quote about the perceived problem by study participants. Having to use inappropriate sources, whether in English or coming from France. Puts us in an #empathy mode. The context @uOttawa is so telling! #OEGlobal22

Yes! I did make it @lachainecath talk! #LinguisticDiversity is a key #OEGlobal22 issue and #LinguisticMinorities are a key context in which we can tackle this issue. Early data gathering results on #OpenEducation for #HigherEd among #Francophone minorities in Canada.

Alignment to national and international standards for educational material, from Idaho to Europe.  @kelly_arispe knows the puzzle inside-out. Wonder how deeply #publishers are involved in this approach to “quality”, given how #LearningExperiences actually work. #OEGlobal22
